skill.name: dev-servers
skill.description: Start the backend (FastAPI/uvicorn) and frontend (Vite) development servers. Use when user mentions 'start dev', 'run servers', 'launch app', 'start the app', or needs to run the application locally.
skill.summary: Start local development servers for FastAPI backend and Vite frontend applications
skill.author: AppleLamps

security_audit.summary: All static findings evaluated as false positives. The skill is a legitimate developer utility for starting local development servers. The 'weak cryptographic algorithm' patterns are false matches on 'uvicorn' text. 'Backtick execution' patterns are markdown code formatting in documentation. Hardcoded URLs are standard localhost addresses. Environment variable access is for configuration validation with explicit guardrails against key exposure.

content.value_statement: Managing multiple development servers for a full-stack application can be error-prone and time-consuming. This skill simplifies launching FastAPI backend and Vite frontend development servers with proper dependency checking and port validation.
actual_capabilities: Start FastAPI backend server with uvicorn on port 8000
Start Vite frontend server on port 5173
Check for installed dependencies before starting servers
limitations: Only supports FastAPI backend and Vite frontend stack
Does not support custom port configurations
Requires pre-existing backend and frontend directories
Cannot manage servers running in Docker containers

use_cases.title: Full-stack Application Development
use_cases.description: Launch both backend and frontend servers simultaneously for full-stack development workflow
use_cases.target_user: Full-stack developers working on Python and JavaScript applications

use_cases.title: Local Development Environment
use_cases.description: Set up a complete local development environment with dependency verification
use_cases.target_user: New team members onboarding to a project

use_cases.title: Application Testing
use_cases.description: Quickly start development servers to test API changes and frontend updates
use_cases.target_user: QA engineers and developers running local tests

prompt_templates.title: Basic Server Start
prompt_templates.prompt: Start the dev servers for my application
prompt_templates.scenario: Simple request to launch all development servers

prompt_templates.title: Run Locally
prompt_templates.scenario: Request to run the application in development mode

prompt_templates.title: Launch Backend and Frontend
prompt_templates.scenario: Explicit request to start both server components

prompt_templates.title: Start Development Environment
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to start the development environment for my FastAPI and Vite project
prompt_templates.scenario: Detailed request with technology stack mentioned

output_examples.output:
I will start the development servers for your application.

Backend (FastAPI/uvicorn): http://localhost:8000
Frontend (Vite): http://localhost:5173

Before starting, I will check if dependencies are installed.

Setting up your local development environment.

1. Checking backend dependencies (Python/venv)...
2. Checking frontend dependencies (node_modules)...
3. Starting uvicorn server on port 8000...
4. Starting Vite dev server on port 5173...

best_practices: Run backend and frontend servers in separate terminals to avoid port conflicts
Ensure OPENAI_API_KEY is set in backend/.env before starting
Check that ports 8000 and 5173 are available before launching
anti_patterns: Running the skill without verifying dependencies are installed first
Starting servers without checking if ports are already in use
Exposing or logging API keys during server startup

faq.question: What servers does this skill start?
faq.answer: The skill starts a FastAPI backend server using uvicorn on port 8000 and a Vite frontend server on port 5173.

faq.question: Does this skill install dependencies?
faq.answer: The skill checks for existing dependencies but does not automatically install them. It will prompt for confirmation before installing.

faq.question: Can I use custom ports?
faq.answer: This version does not support custom port configuration. The backend uses port 8000 and frontend uses port 5173.

faq.question: What if ports are already in use?
faq.answer: The skill includes a guardrail to warn if ports 8000 or 5173 are already in use by another process.

faq.question: Does this skill support Docker containers?
faq.answer: No, this skill is designed for local development servers running directly on the host machine, not containers.

faq.question: What environment variables are required?
faq.answer: The skill checks for OPENAI_API_KEY in backend/.env. This is used for API configuration in the application.
